(Autonomous Municipality) |leader_title1 = |leader_name = John Salcedo Cantos |leader_name1 = |established_title = Founded |established_date = 1838 |founder = Jose Camilo Calixtro |named_for = |area_magnitude = |unit_pref = |area_footnotes = |area_total_km2 = |area_land_km2 = |area_water_km2 = |area_total_sq_mi = |area_land_sq_mi = |area_water_sq_mi = |area_water_percent = |area_metro_km2 = |elevation_footnotes = |elevation_m = 74 |elevation_ft = |elevation_max_m = |elevation_max_ft = |elevation_min_m = |elevation_min_ft = |population_as_of = 2010 |population_footnotes = |population_note = |population_total = 173,585 |population_metro = |population_density_km2 = |population_density_sq_mi = |timezone = ECT |utc_offset = -5 |timezone_DST = |utc_offset_DST = |coor_pinpoint = |coordinates = |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code = 593 5 |website = |footnotes = |blank_name = Climate |blank_info = Aw |blank1_name = Demonym |blank1_info = Quevedeno, -a }} Quevedo is a city in Ecuador located in the Los Rios Province. It is the seat of Quevedo Canton. Quevedo's population is 173,000. http://www.quevedo.gov.ec/Site/Fijos/ciudad.as px, "La Cuidad" Gobierno Municipal de Quevedo 10 August 2010 Because of its location west of the Andes mountains and right next to the Vinces River (a major waterway and tributary to the Pacific Ocean), the city is known for its massive flooding.http://www.columbiagazetteer.org/main/ViewPlace/0/115386 Columbia Gazetteer of the World, Quevedo 10 August 2010 ==References== Category:Cities in Ecuador Category:Los Ríos Province
title: Quevedo, Ecuador
